title: Fix horizontal relationship line alignment in issue list
description: Fixed horizontal relationship lines in the React issue list to align with row centers instead of being hardcoded to 20px offset. Changed centerY calculation from `rect.top - containerRect.top + 20` to `rect.top - containerRect.top + rect.height / 2` to match the original HTML implementation.

title: Restore kebab menu and update status filter behavior
description:
Implemented three improvements to the issue list:
1. Restored kebab menu at each row with Edit, Start/Complete, and Delete actions
2. Pre-selected Ready, Open, and In Progress filters by default
3. Status dropdown stays open when selecting/deselecting statuses (only closes on outside click or ESC key)

title: Fix issue list scrolling with dynamic height calculation
description: Fixed issue list scrolling by adding dynamic height calculation to the task body container. The container now properly calculates available viewport height and sets height/maxHeight, enabling vertical scrolling when content overflows. Implemented ResizeObserver to handle window resizes and layout changes.

title: Add fading scrollbar styling to issue list

comments.author: agent
comments.content: Added custom scrollbar styling to the task-body-container to make scrollbars fade away instead of being always visible. Implemented webkit scrollbar styling for Chrome/Safari/Edge with smooth transitions, and Firefox scrollbar-width: thin for consistent behavior across browsers.

title: Move source assets from media/ to dedicated folders
Fix tree lines jumping when expanding/collapsing descriptions

acceptance_criteria.text: Tree lines remain stable when expanding/collapsing task descriptions
Tree lines recalculate positions after layout changes with proper timing
Tree lines remain stable when scrolling the container

comments.author: agent
comments.content:
Fixed tree lines jumping issue by:
1. Adding expandedDescriptions to TreeLinesSVG dependency array
2. Improving timing with double requestAnimationFrame to wait for layout stabilization
3. Passing expandedDescriptions prop to TreeLinesSVG component

The tree lines now properly recalculate their positions when descriptions expand/collapse, preventing the visual jumping effect.

comments.author: agent
comments.content:
Updated the fix to address scrolling issues:
1. Changed from getBoundingClientRect() to offsetTop for more reliable positioning
2. Added scroll event listener to recalculate lines when container scrolls
3. Ensured positions are calculated relative to the scrollable container properly

The tree lines should now remain stable when expanding/collapsing descriptions, even when scrolled.

title: Fix inconsistent margins between collapsed and expanded description states

acceptance_criteria.text: Collapsed and expanded description states have consistent margins and spacing

comments.author: agent
comments.content: Fixed inconsistent margins between collapsed and expanded description states by adding explicit margin and padding resets to both .description-content.collapsed and .description-content.expanded classes. This ensures consistent spacing regardless of whether the content is showing raw text or parsed HTML.
